title: Relationship to Other Party – Property division

pages.name: AnimalRelationshipToOtherParty
pages.description: The Family Law Act can only be used to resolve disputes about property division in respect of a companion animal if the parties were spouses.

elements.name: otherPartyIsSpouse
elements.title: Was (is) the other party your spouse?
elements.description:
You’re a “spouse” if:
  • you were legally married to your former partner
  • you were unmarried but lived together in a marriage-like relationship for two or more years with your former partner, or
  • you lived in a marriage-like relationship for less than two years, but you have a child together

elements.name: otherPartyRelationshipDesc
elements.title: You and the other party have never been spouses. Please describe your relationship to the other party:
elements.description: You do not need to use any special wording.
